title.narrative: OUTPUT 5.6 COMMUNICATION, ADVOCACY AND PARTNERSHIPS

description.narrative: Output 5.6 Communication, Advocacy And Partnerships, which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Communication And Advocacy (Covid), Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Private Sector Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 5. Program Effectiveness

mailing-address.narrative: Plot 9 George Street PO Box 7047 Kampala

sector.narrative: Leveraging private sector partners for results for children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 5.6 Communication, Advocacy And Partnerships

description.narrative: Increased awareness of the situation of children in Uganda and the Convention on the Rights of the Child was achieved through a mix of public advocacy and partnership activities. Key focus was on amplifying the cross-sector needs and rights of women and children in Uganda, particularly those escalated by the COVID-19 pandemic, on national and international platforms. UNICEF demonstrated its commitment to keeping Ugandan children and young people safe, learning and healthy. UNICEF engaged with traditional stakeholders, including media, private sector and children, and enabled new influencers and audiences to reach especially the most marginalized. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:05/01/2022
